08:11 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I have a small problem. I added the link to delete an application on the AppWithinMinutes.WebHome and I'm checking for space admin rights as you did for the delete space menu. The problem is that I don't have space admin rights if I create an app with a simple user. I guess the app wizard needs to create the WebPreferences page and set the current user as space admin, right?

08:24 <vmassol> sdumitriu: these are quite urgent since they're blocking the 3.5.1 release which we need asap

13:02 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r23262b1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/23262b1f56ef0da062a8bf1692dc42a33c0333b9 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7378: Redirect to the application home page after editing the application class ...

13:49 <+sburjan> vmassol: I corrected what you said about the friday's commit. Funny fact is not what if I use a compound annotation with 2 annotations in it, I get my test running twice :) I will investigate further  
13:49 <vmassol> :)  
14:13 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <+fmancinelli> Guys, I have a license question... Is it fine to link some GPLv3 code into XWiki? On the other hand we are also linking a lot of ASF code, so I guess this is ok though not really clear.  
14:16 <@cjd> My understanding is apache and lgpl are "compatible" while gpl is not.  
14:19 <+tmortagne> fmancinelli: AFAIK no it's not ok, if you use any GPL code the whole thing become GPL but as I have the samee understanding as cjd about lgpl and asf  
14:19 <+tmortagne> s/as I/I/  
14:20 <+fmancinelli> I read that Apache says that ASL and LGPL are compatible, but that's not the opinion of the FSF. For the GPL, in general, I had the same guess... Is it still the case with GPLv3?  
14:21 <+tmortagne> don't know GPLv3 a lot but my understanding is that the v3 tend to be even more restrictive in general  
14:22 <mflorea> has quit  
14:22 <+tmortagne> maybe the guys behind what you are trying to use already had the question and have more informations  
14:24 <@cjd> GPLv3 is seems to be a probabition on patented software but instead it contains a patent pool, similar to how GPLv2 contains a copyright pool.  
14:24 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:24 <@cjd> Software patents on GPLv3 software are free to use in all GPLv3 software (according to my interpretation of the text).  
14:24 <@cjd> off topic :)  
14:25 <+fmancinelli> anyway, I've found a compatibility matrix... So if you want to use a GPLv3 library in a LGPL2.1 project you can do it... provided that you relicense the whole thing as GPLv3 :) So the answer to my question is no :) http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-faq.html#AllCompatibility  
14:28 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <vmassol> fmancinelli: yep, I had the same issue with PircBotX: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-7571  
14:34 <vmassol> (see comment there)  
14:35 <vmassol> since we don't distribute the ircbot app as part of XE I think it's ok to keep XE LGPL  
14:36 <vmassol> however what I understood is that if you start using the ircbot app in your runtime wiki, you make it GPL if you wish to redistribute it  
14:36 <vmassol> hope I got it right… ;)  
14:38 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: git log --follow  
14:38 <vmassol> sdumitriu: doesn't work  
14:39 <vmassol> that's the first thing I tried  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> fmancinelli: No, GPL3 isn't compatible  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> It's OK if it's for an optional extension  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> Like we have the PHP extension  
14:39 <+fmancinelli> hmmm... I don't understand. In the compatibility matrix what I read is this: "If you want to use a GPLv3 library in a project released under LGPLv2.1+ then it's OK if you convery project under LGPLv3"  
14:40 <@sdumitriu> We don't want to convert to LGPL3 yet  
14:41 <+fmancinelli> ops, sorry I meant : "If you want to use a GPLv3 library in a project released under LGPLv2.1+ then it's OK if you convery project under \*\*GPLv3\*\*"  
14:44 <@sdumitriu> (Actually I do, but that's for the whole community to agree on, since we don  
14:44 <@sdumitriu> 't have a copyright assignment form  
14:45 <@sdumitriu> fmancinelli: Exactly  
14:45 <@sdumitriu> This would mean that XWiki becomes GPL  
14:51 <+fmancinelli> sdumitriu, I am lost :) Let's take Vincent's PircBotX... In order to use it, XWiki should be GPL'ed. But since it isn't PircBotX is not usable as a library with the current version of XWiki. To me this means that even if it is an extension (i.e., not committed in xwiki-platform), the precondition for using it is to have a GPL'ed runtime  
14:51 <@sdumitriu> Nope  
14:51 <+fmancinelli> so to me this means that right now, the PircBotX extension is not usable in the current setting. (and the same would be for any GPLv2/3 library)  
14:54 <+tmortagne> hmm platform build seems to be in a very bad shape, 499 failures in the last build  
14:55 <+tmortagne> and it's like that since 3 days actually  
14:58 <@sdumitriu> fmancinelli: The key is in the difference between the official product and each instance  
14:58 <@sdumitriu> We ship XWiki Enterprise  
14:58 <@sdumitriu> Which doesn't have the IRC extension included  
14:58 <@sdumitriu> The moment someone installs XWiki and adds extensions, they make a "derivative work"  
14:59 <@sdumitriu> That instance isn't "XWiki Enterprise" anylonger  
14:59 <@sdumitriu> It's "XWiki Enterprise as available on http://xwiki.org"  
15:00 <@sdumitriu> The official "XWiki Enterprise" can't be affected back by the changes in an instance  
15:00 <@sdumitriu> Like we can't change the license of "Apache HTTPD" if we install a custom GPL plugin on one of our servers  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> What this means is that only our "derivative work" is bound by the GPL license  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> So yes, xwiki.org is now effectively GPL  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> The difference between GPL and LGPL is in how linked code imposes the license  
15:03 <@sdumitriu> So, for us it means that any other application that uses "xe as seen on xwiki.org" as a kind of library must also be GPL  
15:03 <+fmancinelli> sdumitriu, I see. But XWiki.org exists only in binary form. Where is the source code with the GPL headers in source files? :)  
15:03 <@sdumitriu> But I don't think that anybody uses xwiki.org as a library  
15:05 <@sdumitriu> fmancinelli: That's a problem that we'll have to think of when someone actually tries to make us conform to the GPL...  
15:05 <@sdumitriu> But I don't think the GPL header is actually required  
15:05 <@sdumitriu> The license just asks that the code is available  
15:06 <@sdumitriu> And as long as we don't have many custom jars, we can just offer the standard packages  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> Now, there might be another loophole that would make even this "xwiki.org is GPL" requirement invalid  
15:08 <@sdumitriu> Since we can argue that the relation between extensions and the XE platform isn't one of libraries <-> application, but one more like programs <-> operating system  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> I don't know if that would stand up in a courtroom, since I'm not a lawyer, but it's worth a try  
15:11 <@sdumitriu> It's valid because XE doesn't use the extensions, but the extensions use the services offered by the platform  
15:11 <lucaa> has quit  
15:11 <@cjd> I agree that extensions are different because they are not being distributed with the binary.  
15:11 <@cjd> re debian non-free repo  
15:12 <@cjd> and the end user has no such requirement to not link things because he is not copying/distributing.  
15:13 <@sdumitriu> Right, actually this is the main difference between v2 and v3, being available on a network counts as distribution  
15:14 <@cjd> you mean v3 doesn't allow for non-free repos?  
15:14 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> cjd: It all depends on where you set the limit between "library" and "standalone application"  
15:20 <faryshta> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <faryshta> Hi. Is there an idea list for GSoC?  
15:22 <faryshta> I was thinking in adding support for bootstraps or lesscss.  
15:25 <+tmortagne> faryshta: there is http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/#HProposedProjects2829 but you can propose other idea, best place to talk about that is mailing list I think  
15:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <faryshta> tmortagne, I think bootstrap is a major opensource tool. So maybe my idea can be part of the third suggestion. What do you think?  
15:37 <+tmortagne> faryshta: I don't know bootstrap very well but if that's a major open source tool then yes ;)  
15:37 <+fmancinelli> sdumitriu, Thanks for your explanations.  
15:39 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Nice  
15:40 <lucaa> has quit  
15:40 <+evalica> :) sdumitriu you were my inspiration and all the sources I needed :P reusing everything  
15:45 <faryshta> tmortagne, twitter.github.com/bootstrap/  
15:47 <faryshta> tmortagne, bootstraps is a CSS framework. It was created by twitter and used worldwide as a way to avoid wasting time on front end development.  
15:47 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
15:51 <+tmortagne> faryshta: what would be the idea ? just allowing script to use this framework in XWiki ?  
15:53 <faryshta> tmortagne, Yes. Maybe its too simple.  
15:53 <+tmortagne> sounds a bit too simple but i'm not much of a frontend guy so maybe I don't get the main point  
15:55 <faryshta> tmortagne, well the idea is that using this framework you won't need to work on front end anymore.  
15:59 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <+tmortagne> faryshta: the best is probably to detail a proposal in the mailing list  
16:00 <faryshta> tmortagne, k thanks.

17:06 <vmassol> but it looks closed  
17:09 <+sburjan> I see your comments  
17:10 <+sburjan> could you commit it so I  can resync ? and after I will add the regex part  
17:10 <vmassol> why is the pul request closed?  
17:10 <vmassol> I cannot commit anything  
17:10 <vmassol> it's closed  
17:10 <vmassol> also you don't need to resync anything  
17:11 <vmassol> the regex part is about 20 seconds  
17:11 <vmassol> if you find it hard I can add it at the same time as I merge  
17:11 <+sburjan> vmassol: I re-opened the pull request  
17:12 <vmassol> why was it closed?  
17:12 <+sburjan> it would be better if you can add the regex thing if it takes only 20 seconds, for me it would take a little bit longer  
17:12 <vmassol> the question is not how long it would take you  
17:12 <+sburjan> it was closed because I wanted to create a pull request with \_only\_ my modifications  
17:12 <vmassol> but whether you want to learn something or not :)  
17:13 <+sburjan> and I created 2 pull requests, and it seems I closed them by mistake  
17:13 <vmassol> 2?  
17:13 <vmassol> ok… I'll try to sort this out...  
17:13 <vmassol> I need to find some time first  
17:13 <+sburjan> from now on I will create a separate branch on my fork so I won't create mess on official  
17:13 <+sburjan> and I will pull request from that branch and \_not\_ from master  
17:14 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rc89b9fe https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c89b9feae8908c54918fd0f325ea3122e4fed959 / (4 files in 3 dirs): Fix escaping tests. - http://git.io/gy2TqQ  
17:20 <+mflorea> guys, platform builds fails for the past 5 days..  
17:21 <+mflorea> there are lots of unit tests failing

18:13 <faryshta> does xwiki support jquery?  
18:15 <@cjd> faryshta: We use prototypejs which is an alternative to jquery.  
18:15 <vmassol> from https://www.google.fr/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=does+xwiki+support+jquery I'd say yes, but you may want to explain your questioàn  
18:16 <faryshta> cjd, thanks.  
18:16 <@cjd> hehe ask 2 developers, get 2 answers :D  
18:16 <vmassol> cjd: you didn't answer to the question  
18:16 <vmassol> :)  
18:17 <vmassol> xwiki will support whatever js tool you want  
18:17 <@cjd> Indeed I didn't. I played the politician and answered another one.  
18:17 <vmassol> (provided it doesn't conflict with the tools it uses)  
18:17 <vmassol> and for the prototy/jquery conflict it's first result of https://www.google.fr/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=does+xwiki+support+jquery
